intro: Chrysanthemum aureoglobosum, commonly known as the golden globe chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous yellow ray flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in the fall, adding vibrant color to gardens, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes. The species is also valued in traditional Chinese medicine for its potential health benefits.
